title: Riot gave Fiora her bangs back in her splash
body:
http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-n9WkmbxbHUM/VbLYt60NcII/AAAAAAAAuTo/P4C3ILt53V8/s1600/Fiora_Splash_0.jpg

It looks pretty nice now in my opinion.

replies.body: Its just bangs for craps sake, jeez!
They're Fiora's bangs.

It's like if Brock walked around with his eyes open all the time. Wouldn't be good.

It's iconic.

While I don't play {{champion:114}}  (but I most likely will after the update) removing her bangs is like giving {{champion:6}} two legs. It's a essential part of the champions style and is something mains have grown to appreciate.

http://www.surrenderat20.net/2015/07/724-pbe-update.html#more

And people say constant bitching doesn't have a positive effect.

WOO-HOO!~ I know right =D

This is great! Riot, you've done good here, though there's still more to be done. Just know I smiled today thanks to you. 

(Looking at you Royal Guard cleavage.)

Maybe not the cleavage, but give her the old hat back!

That's the one thing I've _sorely_ missed from all of these shenanigans.

In regards to Royal Guard, I don't really care about the cleavage being gone.  If it somehow pleases their social anxieties to have it removed, it's no big loss to me.

But for all that's good, remove that ugly cravat around her neck and replace it with something else.  Give her back her old color palette especially in lieu of that ugly morning piss yellow shirt she's wearing.  She looks like she was attempting haute couture and stumbled through the closet.

I want the old necklace back.

The huge pendant just doesn't fit.

i'm more into riot removing the fugly thigh high boots from the royal guard update

but yeah, royal guard as a whole needs to not use any of the current updated assets into the final piece lol

Well, it may have had the intended effect, but I still hate it when people bitch and moan.

"Riot, we took a poll and agree that we don't like this. Can you change it back?"

vs

"Riot you shit gurgling ass munchers! This hard work you did looks like SHIT! Fix it now or we'll keep raging!"

You see, we've tried the first option.  It doesn't work very well.

The best option to get their attention seems to be harsh and most importantly relentless criticism (not so much blind rage like your second example, just really harsh criticism).  Repeated demonstration of how stupidly easy the needed change is (assuming it IS stupidly easy, but it usually is) is also quite good.

I wish it wasn't that way, but after a few of these reworks the community's pretty much got Riot figured out, and it's on them to change at this point, not us.

But I think the 2nd option can be done a lot better.

Getting downright insulting is really unnecessary and many threads failed to notice that some stuff had already been changed(I saw several threads complaining about the first VU-version of royal guards face,even when they updated it already)

Also if I remember correctly,we actually managed to get the Tristana splash art changed without flooding the boards.

This. I found people to be going about this in an unessecarliy rude manner. i didn't even design the splash and hell _I_ was offended by what people where saying about it, I'm personally impressed with how restrained IronStylus was with how critical people were being about everything. Een bringing up things of the past like {{champion:55}}  splash update like ? It looks great ??? Perfect even.

I found people to be going about this in an unessecarliy rude manner. i didn't even design the splash and hell _I_ was offended by what people where saying about it, I'm personally impressed with how restrained IronStylus was with how critical people were being about everything. Een bringing up things of the past like {{champion:55}}  splash update like ? It looks great ??? Perfect even.

Seriously, people were being downright hostile; that was abusive behavior

Considering how this is the first time a major community outcry has actually effected change in the face of ironStylus telling us to essentially go fuck ourselves, I'd say the reaction was both warranted and completely necessary.  It's pretty telling how throughout all this he's refused to even address us or our complaints here.  If he had been willing to address us like a mature adult and actually _listen_ to our heartfelt complaints for once it wouldn't have come to this.

Its not the first time that we managed to affect a change.
The splash arts for {{champion:103}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:18}} {{champion:62}} were all changed based on community feedback,{{champion:64}} kit rework was halted because of community reaction,{{champion:222}} skin color was changed due to community feedback,{{champion:126}} lore was changed because of the community.

And there are probably more occasions where the community changed the outcome of something.

Ironstylus never said to go fuck yourself,he explained that he himself actually didn't have that much to do with the splash art and more with the concept art,that changing the hair back could prove difficult due to technical problems,that they currently shift the artstyle to a more stylized one and that he will post a devblog about the current shift in overall design for lol.
But he also said that they are gonna adress her ingame faces,as well as the face on the splash art(which they did),which is exactly what people have been asking for.

The ones who didn't act like adults were those who accused him of being a straw feminist just because Ironstylus dared to mention the importance of "distinctiveness" and didn't care that he actually confirmed that changes were already in the works.

No. Overflowing forum with some useless QQs. And did it help? Is game more balanced? More playable? For 99% of players ... No. No room for creative discussions, just kids cries.
Remember how the hair in the face was "too much work from a technical standpoint on Fiora's rigging"? Funny how that changed quick....

> [{quoted}](name=Retillin,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=f7RPg1Q6,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-07-25T01:55:26.382+0000)

Ikr the TOO MUCH WORK excuse is so fucking stupid, YOU'RE A GAMING COMPANY RIOT, YOU WORK HARD IN ORDER TO SUCCEED YOU DON'T PUT OUT SHIT WORK AND BE LIKE OH ITS TOO HARD, what a BS excuse that was... A COMPANY saying its "Too much work"
Pisses me off way more than it should but its so very true...

They never said the face would be too much work and Ironstylus said that the hair "might" be too much work from a technical standpoint,depending on the coding.It turned out that the coding wasn't a problem for the hair,so they changed it.

Well, now if they'd only add those bangs on her models.

"Too much work", says Ironstylus.

**Edit:**
Oh, wait. They did it!

http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Oma_ZpgIh50/VbLbfplesvI/AAAAAAAAuUA/uSIZn_FYyTM/s1600/fioracompare.jpg

So, was it really that hard, hm?

It's certainly a step in the right direction!

I know we're not going to get 100% our way (especially with divided opinions), but hey we got her bangs back.
Just remember that "OUR" is a smaller percentage than you think.

it's kind of why I added "especially with divided opinions" on there.

There's people who are completely fine with the new splash and models, and I respect those opinions.

But hey, I'm going to share my opinion, hope it gets heard, and hope it gets acted on. If it doesn't, oh well, but I'm still pretty happy with the progress right now.

Then why do people say "Everyone agrees this is good/bad . . ." or "We don't like this. . ."

Why did you say "We're not going to get 100% our way" when every person has a different opinion? By that logic, nobody can get 100% their way on anything.

Well I was responding to a guy who wanted her bangs back too

You have a fair point, though. I'll keep it in mind for the future.
I liked her new bang less splash -_-

Go away, k dankz bai.

It looks much better. Unfortunately, it looks better because her face is more covered up :P

They don't listen. The old splash was perfectly fine, and plenty of people just want the old Fiora and old model back with some texture updates.

Until they do that, then yeah, they don't listen, so?

I get that they're trying to compromise their desires with ours, but they need a better reason than "well it doesn't fit our stylistic goals" if said stylistic goals results in the atrocities called her new models and the first splash art.

This one is OKAY, but I still want the old one back.

Nothing can really replace the perfection that was the old Fiora splash (same issue with {{champion:18}}).

But this, this I am perfectly fine with. Thank you Riot.

Check the link, it's been added to the model as well.

Riot listened!

If you check the link, they actually touched up on it a lot.  It's still rather defined, but it's a lot less so and she looks a good deal younger now, and not as old and overly-defined.
They did soften the features a bit so it's not as angular and more rounded.
Yeah, it looks a lot better. I still think the face is too gaunt, but it looks good enough to bring me out of salt-mode.
Now all the board babies can stop whining about her new splash.
